result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Ricky L Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Intimidate Witness, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes: In the event Defendant satisfies conditions, State will move to dismiss Count 1.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work, school, or combination of the two or as deemed appropriate by his Probation Agent.

Commit no further law violations during the period of this agreement. Have no contact with Kari Carmody. Defendant understands that "no contact" means no direct or indirect contact, whether in person, by phone, or by mail, and whether initiated by the defendant or by someone on the defendant's behalf. The only exceptions to this condition will be for contact as required by any mediation agreement, counseling, or letter of apology required by this DAGP. Consume no alcohol beverages or controlled substances without a valid prescription and to use only as prescribed. No entry into bars or taverns. Not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall inform his prescribing health provider of his past diversion of his prescribed controlled substances by providing a copy of the Criminal Complaint and this DAGPA to his prescribing health care provider. Proof this has occurred shall be provided to the District Attorney's Office by January 1, 2015.

Take any/all medicines prescribed to the defendant by a licensed physician and only as prescribed. There shall be no diversion of prescribed medications. Defendant shall comply with any and all rules of probation and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as a part of this case. Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office. Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted. This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.

Complete an Alcohol and/or Other Drug Abuse (AODA) Assessment with a certified Alcohol and Drug Abuse Counselor, at an appropriate counseling or treatment center and willingly cooperate in any recommended counseling or treatment. The defendant must ensure that the counselor sends the written results of said assessment to the District Attorney's Office on or before March 1, 2015. If counseling is recommended, the defendant must ensure that the counselor sends written documentation of the defendant's attendance and compliance with any recommendation to the District Attorney's Office by January 1, 2016.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall perform 25 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency or organization, providing proof of such community service to the Door County District Attorney's office at least thirty (30) days before the expiration of this agreement.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs on each count. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.

Not to possess firearms. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact direct or indirect with Kari Carmody.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: 30 days of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through Petition of Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.
Perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service for a non-profit agency. Consecutive to hours contained within DAGPA.

Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement
by State

Defendant Ricky L Clark in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Amended Information adding Counts 2, 3, 4. Defense waives reading of Information. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1-4. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas on Counts 2-4, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2-4. Court finds basis to accept plea on Count 1, withholds acceptance of plea, reviews conditions contained within DAGPA, approves DAGPA. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Bond continues as is. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations on Counts 2, 3, 4. Defendant makes statement.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 13, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ricky L Clark in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that case will proceed to trial. Motions due by 11/3. Counsel to advise by noon on 11/7 if case has resolved.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ricky L Clark in court.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions parties on status. State advises that she has met with Defendant.  Defendant received an offer. Court questions Defendant, who does not qualify for PD, wants Court-appointed Counsel.  Petition given to Defendant with instructions.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ricky L Clark in court.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress with State.  State advises that Defendant did not meet with them, scheduled an appointment but called in to cancel, never rescheduled.  Defense agrees, advises that he met with Joan Korb who did not want to talk about the case because of intimidation of witness/bail jumping charges that might be filed.  State advises of offer sent to Defendant.  Defendant will not accept offer, will be hiring his own counsel.  Defendant wants ADA Korb taken off case, believes he is being intimidated by State.  State advises that Defendant doesn't get to choose his prosecutor.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 3/10/14.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Ricky L Clark in court.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defendant is not going to get an attorney, will not represent himself at trial, wants to plead guilty.  Court suggests that Defendant speak with DA before he enters plea, questions Defendant on how he wants to proceed.  Defendant wants to waive right to counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.
